intro: Symplocos ulotricha, commonly known as the roughleaf beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other well-known plants like blueberries and heathers. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It produces small, clustered white flowers in the spring, followed by bright purple berries in the fall. These berries are a valuable food source for birds and other wildlife.
